Title: Title
autoconfig_expl: The autoconfig DNS entry is used to automatically configure email clients, like Thunderbird, with the correct server settings for a domain. It simplifies the setup process by providing necessary details without manual input, enabling seamless email client connectivity. Autoconfig DNS records are recommended to at least be available in internal networks for clients to seamlessly connect.
autodiscoverSrv_expl: The _autodiscover._tcp record is a DNS entry used by some email clients, like mobile devices, to locate a domain's server settings for email configuration. Unlike the standard autodiscover record, which is used primarily by Outlook, the _autodiscover._tcp record caters to a wider range of clients, facilitating the automatic setup process and ensuring compatibility across various devices, especially mobile devices.
autodiscover_expl: The autodiscover DNS entry streamlines email client configuration by automatically locating the server settings for a specific domain. It helps simplify the process of connecting email clients, like Outlook, to mail servers by eliminating manual input of server details. Autodiscover records are recommended to at least be available in internal networks for clients to seamlessly connect. However, with more recent versions of Microsoft Outlook (2016+), it is also recommended to have Autodiscover records also available externally, since the default setting of Microsoft Outlook uses Microsoft's online services by proxy. For more information, please consult the grommunio documentation available at
caldav_expl: A _caldav._tcp DNS record for CalDAV and _caldavs._tcp DNS record for CalDAV over TLS (encrypted) is a DNS entry that helps clients locate a domain's CalDAV server for calendar synchronization. It enables seamless discovery of server details, simplifying the configuration process and facilitating calendar sharing and collaboration across multiple devices and users. CalDAV(s) SRV records are optional, however simplify the configuration process for CalDAV clients.
carddav_expl: A _carddav._tcp DNS record for CardDAV and _carddavs._tcp DNS record for CardDAV over TLS (encrypted) is a DNS entry that guides clients to a domain's CardDAV server for contact synchronization. It streamlines the discovery of server details, making it easier to configure contact sharing and management across multiple devices and users. CardDAV(s) SRV records are optional, however simplify the configuration process for CardDAV clients.
changePw_sub: Changes the password of the current Admin Web user
configInstructions2: Be careful not to duplicate the <1>"customImages"</1>
contacts_sub: This contacts overview shows a full list of all contacts of this domain.
davtxt_expl: The _caldav._tcp_, caldavs._tcp, _carddav._tcp_ and carddavs._tcp TXT records for CalDAV and CardDAV over TLS (encrypted) are DNS entries that helps clients locate a domain's CalDAV server for calendar synchronization. It enables seamless discovery of server details, simplifying the configuration process and facilitating calendar sharing, contact sharing and collaboration across multiple devices and users. These TXT records are optional, however simplify the configuration process for CalDAV and CardDAV clients.
dbconf_sub: Here you can create and edit configuration files to manage services
deleteDialog: Are you sure you want to delete {{item}}
design_sub: Here you can define server-wide imagesets to white-label grommunio-admin-web
dkim_expl: A DKIM (DomainKeys Identified Mail) entry is a DNS record that enables email signing with a unique cryptographic signature. It allows recipients to verify the email's sender and integrity, reducing the likelihood of spam and phishing attacks while enhancing email deliverability and trustworthiness. DKIM DNS records are only recommended for external validation and traditionally are not required in private networks.
dmarc_expl: A DMARC (Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting, and Conformance) entry is a DNS record that establishes a domain's email authentication policy. It combines SPF and DKIM mechanisms, instructing receiving mail servers how to handle unauthenticated emails, thus enhancing email security and minimizing spam, phishing, and spoofing threats. DMARC DNS records are only recommended for external validation and traditionally are not required in private networks.
domains_sub: The domains overview shows all configured and accepted mail domains for the installation.
external_ip_expl: An external address, or public IP, is detected for the system when it uses Network Address Translation (NAT) through a gateway to access the internet. NAT allows multiple devices on a local network to share a single public IP address, provided by the Internet Service Provider (ISP). This public IP serves as the system's unique identifier on the internet, enabling communication with external networks while masking individual private IP addresses. This external IP was detected to be used for this system to check if the corresponding DNS records match.
folders_sub: Folders provide shared access to information in this domain
globalcontacts_sub: This contacts overview shows a full list of all contacts, regardless of their associated domain.
globalusers_sub: This users overview shows a full list of all configured and accepted users and groups, regardless of their associated domain.
groups_sub: Groups provide an easy way to classify groups of users
imap_expl: A _imap._tcp DNS record for IMAP and _imaps._tcp DNS record for IMAP over TLS (encrypted) is a DNS entry that points clients to a domain's IMAP server for email retrieval. It simplifies the discovery of server details, allowing email clients to easily configure access to email accounts and synchronize messages across multiple devices and applications via IMAP. IMAP(s) SRV records are optional, however simplify the configuration process for IMAP clients.
ldap_attribute_desc: This controls which attributes the "Search in LDAP" functionality will look at when searching with an arbitrary search string.
ldap_defaultQuota_desc: Storage quota of imported users if no mapping exists
ldap_groupMemberAttr_desc: Attribute containing the groups a user is member of
ldap_groupaddr_desc: E-Mail address attribute of the group
ldap_groupname: Attribute containing the group's display name
ldap_import_tooltip: Import not-yet imported ldap users and synchronize already imported ones
ldap_mapping_desc: LDAP attribute to map -> Name of the user property to map to. Any mappings specified take precendence over active templates
ldap_oID_desc: Name of an attribute that uniquely identifies an LDAP object
ldap_password_desc: Password for bindUser (always uses LDAP Simple Authentication)
ldap_server_desc: Space-separated list of URIs (only schema, host and port; no base)
ldap_settingsHelp: LDAP server configuration. User sychronization can be found at the list of users of individual domains
ldap_sub: The directory configuration manages synchronization, import and authentication of an LDAP-based directory
ldap_username_desc: Name of the attribute that corresponds to the username (e-mail address)
license_sub: In this view you can upload your license and check which users occupy user slots
livestatus_sub: A comprehensive overview over all requests being processed of all nodes
local_ip_expl: The local network IP, or Internet Protocol address, is the numerical identifier assigned to this system within the Local Area Network (LAN) to facilitate communication and data exchange. It operates on the IPv4 or IPv6 addressing scheme, and utilizes subnet masks to differentiate network and host portions of the address. This private IP can be non-routable, meaning it would not be directly accessed from the internet. Depending on your intended setup, this could also be set to a public adress and should match with your corresponding DNS records.
logs_sub: Logs provide insight into service operation
mailfilter_sub: Mail filter statistics provide an overview over the mail volume processed.
mailq_sub: The mail queue provides an overview over processed e-mails
mlists_sub: Mail lists are mailboxes which forward e-mails to all its members
mx_expl: An MX (Mail Exchange) record is a type of DNS (Domain Name System) entry used to direct email traffic to the appropriate mail server. It specifies which server is responsible for receiving and processing email messages sent to a particular domain. Typically, MX records are recommended to be available in both internal and external networks.
orgs_sub: Organizations group multiple domains together to a single tenant, sharing resources such as a shared global adress book.
performance_sub: Performance overview delivers information of the system's health, the current service status as well as available resources.
pop3_expl: A _pop3._tcp record is a DNS entry that directs clients to a domain's POP3 server for email access. It facilitates the discovery of server details, enabling email clients to conveniently configure and retrieve email messages from the mail server across different devices and applications via POP3. POP3(s) SRV records are optional, however simplify the configuration process for POP3 clients.
quotaWarning1: A quota exceeding 50GB has been established; however, it has not yet been reached. Be advised that for stable operation in cached mode, Microsoft Outlook requires specific configuration adjustments.
quotaWarning2: The mailbox has exceeded a quota size of 50GB. Please be aware that configuration changes are necessary for Microsoft Outlook to function stably in cached mode.
quotaWarning3: A quota exceeding 100GB has been established; however, it has not yet been reached. Be advised that Microsoft Outlook supports cached mode stably only up to 100GB.
quotaWarning4: This mailbox has exceeded a quota size of 100GB. Please be aware that Microsoft Outlook supports stable operation in cached mode only for mailbox sizes up to 100GB.
roles_sub: Roles provide an overview over all roles available for access to the Admin UI and API.
settings_sub: Local settings which only effect this browser
spf_expl: An SPF (Sender Policy Framework) entry is a DNS TXT record that specifies which mail servers are authorized to send email on behalf of a domain. It helps prevent email spoofing and spam by allowing recipients to verify the sender's authenticity, thus improving email deliverability and security. SPF DNS records are only recommended for external validation and traditionally are not required in private networks.
submission_expl: A _submission._tcp record is a DNS entry that guides clients to a domain's submission server for sending email. It simplifies server details discovery, allowing email clients to effortlessly configure outgoing mail settings and ensure reliable email delivery across various devices. Submission SRV records are optional, however simplify the configuration process for SMTP-sending clients.
sync_sub: Listing of all mobile devices with current activity
sync_warning: This option pushes the folder contents to all mobile devices of users that have read and write permissions on this folder. Use with caution as this may result in high impact on your server and mobile devices.
updater_sub: Here you can update/upgrade your grommunio installation
users_sub: This users overview shows a full list of all configured and accepted users of this domain.
